programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: CODE

programme.title: What She Wants

programme.title: Bars
programme.desc: A woman's idyllic world comes crashing down when she's sentenced to life in prison for a crime she didn't commit. She soon finds strength and solace among a group of tight-knit inmates known as the Pretty Girls.

programme.title: Ebony's Christmas Carol
programme.desc: A bitter winery owner is visited by three spirits who urge her to face the past and rediscover the joy she’s lost around the Christmas season.

programme.title: Festive Fling

Desperate to move on from the pain of her past, she invites her co-worker Greg to visit her family to pretend to be her boyfriend to deflect her family's unwanted comments. Little did she know, that her holiday fling, would become a holiday thing.

programme.title: The Laundry Room Stalker
programme.desc: A string of murders targeting local neighborhood sex workers centers around one apartment building's laundry room. Suspicion quickly falls on Calvin, the newly hired attendant who was just released after serving 12 years in prison. But this building holds a thousand secrets, and as tensions rise, the truth will unravel. Who is the real killer?

programme.title: Money Gang Lit
programme.desc: Hakeem Benson, a down-on-his-luck videographer, is evicted and adrift. He takes a risky music video gig for Bull Dawg, a notorious kingpin. But when a respected gang member is murdered, Hakeem is falsely accused and targeted. Now, in a city on fire, he's fighting for his life and meaning amidst the chaos.

programme.desc: Exposed

programme.title: My Man
programme.desc: Trina, a young model, becomes entangled with Max. As their relationship deepens, she uncovers his dark secrets: a double life, a psychotic ex-girlfriend, and a dangerous obsession. When Trina crosses a line, she becomes the target of a deadly game of cat and mouse. Betrayal, madness, and murder ensue as the lines between love, obsession, and survival blur.

programme.title: SistAhood
programme.desc: A woman who returns home to Georgia to be closer to loved ones finds a different reality, one that she gets through with her circle of girlfriends.

programme.title: Keisha
programme.desc: Struggling to take care of her son and pay bills, Keisha is forced to turn to exotic dancing to keep from sliding deeper into poverty.

programme.title: Induced 2

His friend Kordell, who's an adult film star, helps him with a way to make a lot of money overnight. When they're sent to a house to possibly film a scene, that turns out to be a real life exorcism.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: Totally Bill Hicks
programme.desc: This special consists of two parts: “It's Just A Ride”, a documentary about Hicks' life which features interviews from friends, admirers, and family; “Revelations”, a recording of his last live performance in the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Todd Glass Talks About Stuff
programme.desc: In this caustic comedy special, veteran stand-up quipster Todd Glass makes audiences howl with his take on some of society's unspoken "rules," from complimenting kids to giving directions.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Lil Rel Howery - RELevent
programme.desc: Hart hosts the high-energy comic who riffs on his upbringing, raising kids, and public transportation, proving he can be hilarious and relevant.

programme.title: Jimmy Della Valle: Famous Nobody
programme.desc: Comedian Jimmy Della Valle is well-known for his high energy, rapid-fire delivery, amazing improvisation skills, and hilarious one-liners.

programme.title: Shayne Smith: Alligator Boys
programme.desc: This comic delivers wild stories about everything, from a failed robbery, to a wrestling match in the NYC subway, and even about saving a dog’s life.

programme.title: Shayne Smith: Prison for Wizards
programme.desc: Award-winning stand-up and former gang member Shayne Smith talks Azkaban prison tattoos, diabetic dogs, hacker moms, and more in this live special.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Rob Schneider: Soy Sauce and the Holocaust
programme.desc: Rob Schneider takes on lessons about love and other cultures, and telling side-splitting stories of the three hoods: childhood, adulthood, and parenthood.

programme.title: Mark Christopher Lawrence: Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist Mark Christopher Lawrence brings his comedy to the Dry Bar stage.

programme.title: Marc Maron: Thinky Pain
programme.desc: The hilarious podcaster and comedian takes stock of his own neuroses and self-loathing while providing brilliant insights on life.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Underwear
programme.desc: The iconic comic plays on the challenges of getting healthy, life on the road, dealing with technology and how we all eventually become our parents.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Baby Boomer
programme.desc: Veteran funny man Louie Anderson returns to the stage in this hilarious one hour stand up comedy special. Louie takes an unconventional and jovial look at his bad habits, pesky family members, and aging body.

programme.title: Matt Besser: Pot Humor
programme.desc: Matt Besser delivers “a TED Talk for stoners” in his live show at the North West Cannabis Club in Portland, Oregon with an audience that inhales.

programme.title: Matt Besser: Besser Breaks the Record
programme.desc: Matt Besser is here to air some grievances and break some comedy records, just don't bring up weed and he'll stay on track. With a new set of commandments, a collection of letters to the editor and his nemesis Ivan Krushnev Jr. making an appearance, this special is like no other! Filmed live at the UCB theater in Hollywood.

programme.title: Josh Blue: Delete
programme.desc: With an undeniably unique world view, Blue explores preconceived notions of disability and how the community feels about being called “inspirational.”

programme.title: Josh Blue: The Disabled List
programme.desc: The winner of Last Comic Standing discusses the obvious questions people ask him, misunderstandings about being a disabled person, and more.

programme.title: Josh Blue: Sticky Change
programme.desc: Quipster Josh Blue hits the stage where he turns his cerebral palsy and cross-cultural marriage into comedy gold.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: Freezing Hot
programme.desc: The acclaimed Last Comic Standing winner explains how women hate being cold, but love cold weather, and other hilarious observations.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Skinny Bitch
programme.desc: Witty, razor-sharp observations abound in this stand-up performance from Gina Yashere. From bits about her mom and men, to colonic irrigation and luggage this special leaves no stone unturned.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Laughing to America
programme.desc: Live from San Francisco, UK's top black female comedian Gina Yashere brings her unique insider-outsider perspective on America's hottest news.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: Fake News, Real Jokes
programme.desc: The king of dry wit is back to take down the current political and social climate — from selfies to airline travel to Donald Trump and the media.

programme.title: Aries Spears: Comedy Blueprint
programme.desc: The MADTV alum takes the stage in Philadelphia to deliver jokes and impressions, where no one is spared from his ferociously aggressive comic style.

programme.title: Helen Hong: Well Hong
programme.desc: The comedian and actor takes to the stage to confess she spent the Covid quarantine trying to date doomsday preppers and stealing her dog's Xanax.

programme.title: Damon Sumner: I'm a Professional
programme.desc: In his debut special, Damon Sumner hilariously dives into his inability to maintain a social life, raising both his kids and those of others and maintaining friendships as a couple at The Limelight Theater in Atlanta, Ga.

programme.title: Elon Gold: Chosen & Taken
programme.desc: Elon Gold unleashes his sharp, biting humor in his comedy special Chosen & Taken. His manic wit transcends race and religion to celebrate the absurd things people do.

programme.title: Kiran Deol: Joysuck
programme.desc: The Emmy-nominated storyteller delivers her first original comedy special about societal ills, the perils of therapy, drugs, and dicks on your back.

programme.title: Patrick Holbert: Qualification
programme.desc: Patrick Holbert takes his comedy to an undisclosed 12-step gathering to tackle addiction, recovery, family, and being a white rapper.

programme.title: Paul Oddo: My Name Is Paul
programme.desc: The razor-sharp veteran comedian-slash-philosopher ruminates on dating and our place in the universe from Rozco's Comedy Club in Austin, Texas.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Jenny McCarthy’s brand of naughty comedy gets a boost from popular female comedians, including Tiffany Haddish, on the realities of being a woman.

programme.title: David Cross: Oh, Come On
programme.desc: David Cross takes viewers into the abyss of his thoughts in this stand-up set about couples’ colonics, waiting to bond with a newborn, and politics.

programme.title: Alonzo Bodden: Tall, Dark and Funny
programme.desc: Alonzo hilariously touches upon every subject from tsunamis to terrorists, Democrats to desperate housewives, marriage to midgets, and more,

programme.title: Ilana Glazer: The Planet Is Burning
programme.desc: “Broad City” star Ilana Glazer steps up in her first standup comedy set, done in her own raucous style as she takes on Nazis, diva cups, and stoners.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Keith Robinson - Back of the Bus Funny
programme.desc: The comic brings his in-your-face style to everything from the moment he stopped liking his son to the real reason why Obama was elected.

programme.title: Plastic Cup Boyz
programme.desc: Filmed live and led by Kevin Hart, the comedy group The Plastic Cup Boyz step into the spotlight with their hilarious stand-up and sketches.

programme.title: Last ExMas
programme.desc: Ex-girlfriends whose bitter breakup led them down different paths find themselves rekindling their spark during a hometown visit over the holidays.

programme.title: Margaret Cho: Psycho
programme.desc: The comic provocateur tackles a new list of taboos—from race to sexuality to Boko Haram—in front of a live audience at New York’s Town Hall.

programme.title: Yakov Smirnoff: As Long as We Both Shall Laugh
programme.desc: Russian comedian Yakov Smirnoff’s comedy show was filmed live in NYC, direct from Broadway, as he takes on the differences between men and women.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Achmed Saves America
programme.desc: The world's most incompetent terrorist finds himself whisked away from his homeland and taken to Americaville, USA.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef Paula Deen selects items for the mystery box challenge, which includes Southern staples and a surprise for the contestants.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To make a MASTERCHEF-worthy duck dish, the top 14 junior home cooks must learn to butcher a whole bird, in one of the toughest mystery box challenges yet! Then, with huge stakes at hand, the cooks will work in pairs to make a dozen delectable cupcakes and the winning pair will have their recipe published in the all-new MASTERCHEF JUNIOR COOKBOOK. Find out who will succeed.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To become America’s next Junior MASTERCHEF, the top 14 home cooks head to the great outdoors for a chicken cookout. Hungry campers at the KIDS CAMP MASTERCHEF will decide which dish reigns supreme, and the winning team’s recipe will be featured in Family Circle Magazine. The losing team must face a coconut cream pie pressure test that proves to be not as “sweet” as it may seem. Find out who’s MASTERCHEF dreams will go up in flames.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay journeys to Ridgewood, New Jersey to rejuvenate Bazzini, an Italian eatery hampered by sluggish service and a lackluster kitchen staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mojito's, a Cuban eatery in Brooklyn. The owners purchased the restaurant as newlyweds, but they are now seven years into a crumbling marriage and business.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: After a lesson on the importance of teamwork in the kitchen, Chef Ramsay reveals that the chefs will be cooking five commonly served "staple" dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The final ten chefs are surprised when Gordon Ramsay brings in his daughter Tilly to celebrate her sweet sixteen.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining contestants try to impress the judges.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef Paula Deen selects items for the mystery box challenge, which includes Southern staples and a surprise for the contestants.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 12 are in for a surprise when the kids from Kidz Bop arrive and put their twist on a mystery box challenge, deciding which ingredients the home cooks must craft into an elevated dish full of personality. Only one will win a huge advantage, forever altering his/or/her MASTERCHEF journey in a “blast from the past” elimination test. Find out who makes it into the Top 10.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It’s a battle to the finish line when the Top 10 are tasked with a pasta race. The home cooks are divided into teams and compete to roll out the longest sheet of pasta as fast as they possibly can. The first team’s pasta sheet to make it to the winner’s circle will be safe and exempt from a high-stakes elimination test in which éclairs are the dish du jour. No detail will go unnoticed.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Lido di Manhattan, an Italian joint with an unsightly kitchen and inexperienced owner. He is so horrified that he shuts the place down temporarily.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by a French eatery and discovers that he and the head chef have similar culinary training. However, the chef is in denial about the poor quality of his restaurant's food.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay challenges the nine remaining chefs to prepare authentic Chinese dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Both teams are down to four chefs each as the competition continues to heat up. The dining room gets an Italian transformation for one of the most anticipated challenges of the season: the blind taste test.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Amateur chefs compete in cooking challenges overseen by a panel of accomplished chefs to survive elimination and become a culinary master, earning the title MasterChef.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 10 participate in the season’s most crucial team challenge when the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR restaurant opens its doors to a special group of VIP female role models. The team that dishes up the most impressive meal will go straight into the Top 8, but it’s going to take more than skill to win over this exclusive group of guests. The losing team will face a Gordon Ramsay masterclass in which they will be tasked with replicating a three-Michelin-star-rated dish. See who advances.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The race to be the next MASTERCHEF JUNIOR shifts into full gear as the Top Eight pair up in the most intense mystery box challenge of the season, in which the chef-testants are challenged to pull off something highly creative and seriously delicious with corn. Only one will win a game-changing advantage that is certain to cause a ruckus in the tapas-themed, tag-team challenge. The best junior home cooks in America are put to the test.

programme.title: Danika
programme.desc: A wife and mother of three lives a wonderful life, until her everyday worries begin to grow and manifest themselves in gruesome, horrific reality.

programme.title: Dario Argento's Trauma (Broadcast Edit)
programme.desc: In this heart-pounding Italian thriller, a young man tries to help an escaped psychiatric patient find the serial killer who murdered her parents.

programme.title: Spiders
programme.desc: A spaceship bearing a mutant spider falls to the desert, where a curious reporter must warn the world about the deadly creature before it's too late.

programme.title: The Music Box
programme.desc: An orphaned six-year-old is caught under the spell of a mysterious music box and it’s up to her aunt to save her before the last note plays.

programme.title: A Deadly Lullaby
programme.desc: Six months ago, two baby girls were born at the same time at the same hospital. Olivia’s died—but the baby belonging to her husband’s boss survived.

programme.title: The Pit
programme.desc: When a solitary and strange adolescent boy makes a disturbing discovery in the depths of the forest, he wreaks vengeance on those who harass him.

programme.title: Spiders
programme.desc: A spaceship bearing a mutant spider falls to the desert, where a curious reporter must warn the world about the deadly creature before it's too late.

programme.title: The Stay Awake
programme.desc: The ghost of a serial killer, executed for murdering students at a Catholic girls' school, returns to take revenge on the current student body.

programme.title: Ghosthunters
programme.desc: When one of their own loses his family to a serial killer, a team of ghost hunters is determined to find their spirits and help them rest in peace.

programme.title: Elvira's Haunted Hills
programme.desc: The hilarious horror hostess returns in this campy tale of a castle visit that goes awry when Elvira spots a spirit that looks eerily familiar.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: Hollow Creek
programme.desc: A popular horror novelist heads to spooky Appalachia in search of inspiration, and becomes the prime suspect in a missing person case.

programme.title: Wolvesbayne
programme.desc: When a vampire clan seeks to restore ancient evils, a posse of vampire hunters, led by Jacob Van Helsing and a newly-turned werewolf, must stop them.

programme.title: Dario Argento's Trauma (Broadcast Edit)
programme.desc: In this heart-pounding Italian thriller, a young man tries to help an escaped psychiatric patient find the serial killer who murdered her parents.

programme.title: Danika
programme.desc: A wife and mother of three lives a wonderful life, until her everyday worries begin to grow and manifest themselves in gruesome, horrific reality.

programme.title: Charlie's Farm
programme.desc: Ignoring warnings, four friends head into the Australian outback to visit the site where a violent family met their end at the hands of an angry mob.

programme.title: The Legend of Bloody Jack
programme.desc: Campfire urban legend Bloody Jack comes to life when one of his kin resurrects him from the dead.

programme.title: Megaboa
programme.desc: On a trip to Colombia, a group of college students encounter a sixty-foot boa constrictor, hungry for blood.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls (In Color)
programme.desc: After a deadly car accident, a young church organist finds herself stalked by mysterious phantoms that beckon her to an abandoned carnival.

programme.title: Raging Sharks
programme.desc: A bizarre outbreak of shark attacks leave the crew of an underwater outpost in desperate trouble, while a Navy submarine delivers fresh dangers.

programme.title: Maneater
programme.desc: When an escaped Bengal tiger terrorizes a small Appalachian town, it’s up to the local sheriff, a game-hunter, and a gifted boy to stop the creature.

programme.title: The Pumpkin Karver
programme.desc: On the year anniversary that a man murdered his sister’s boyfriend, who he thought was a masked Halloween killer, a real masked killer comes knocking.

programme.title: Shark Attack 3: Megalodon
programme.desc: A team of researchers are up against a prehistoric, huge shark as they search for clues on the Mexican coast after finding one of its gigantic teeth.

programme.title: The Willies
programme.desc: At night In the woods, three school boys take turns around the campfire spinning yarns about a chicken-fried rat, huge flies, and a bathroom monster.

programme.title: Ticks
programme.desc: A trip into the wilderness is supposed to reform some delinquent kids, but the bloodthirsty mutant parasites that live there are the real problem.

programme.title: The Vault
programme.desc: Forced by desperate circumstances, two sisters rob a bank and are given instructions to check an old vault, where something dark resides.

programme.title: My Friend Dahmer
programme.desc: Based on a graphic novel, the story of an awkward young Jeffrey Dahmer portrays the haunting struggle of a lonely high school boy who did not fit in.

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Uninvited
programme.desc: When a mutated cat escapes a lab study, it becomes the unlikely foil to a shady businessman’s banking scam aboard a yacht headed to the Caribbean.

programme.title: Sweet 16
programme.desc: A lonely girl tries to make new friends, but she might spend her 16th birthday alone behind bars, since every boy she meets soon ends up dead.

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: After murdering his entire family, a man remarries a widow with a teenage daughter in another town and prepares to do the same thing all over again.

programme.title: Stepfather II
programme.desc: After cheating death by surviving being both stabbed and shot, psychotic killer Jerry (Terry O'Quinn) is placed in a mental institution, but he soon murders his doctor and escapes. Taking on a dead man's identity, he moves to an upscale neighborhood in Los Angeles and sets his sights on local woman Carol (Meg Foster), slowly winning her heart. Carol's son, Todd (Jonathan Brandis), grows suspicious of his mom's new lover, however, and tensions reach the boiling point at the couple's wedding.

programme.title: Stepfather III: Father's Day
programme.desc: An escaped madman (Robert Wightman) romances a California divorcee; luckily her son knows how to use a computer.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: A married couple, lost in the woods, stumble across a creepy mansion and its inhabitants - an overly-kind old women and deadly wolf children that scour the country-side looking for victims.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: An elderly pet shop owner, who is secretly a former Nazi concentration camp guard, is intent on continuing experiments on human victims. His plan is to create prisons with no bars, for which he captures a former prison inmate and his wife.

programme.title: The Little Shop of Horrors (Colorized)
programme.desc: In a flower shop on Skid Row, a clumsy young employee is turned into a killer when the talking plant he’s nurturing requires human blood to thrive.

programme.title: Amityville: It's About Time
programme.desc: After a widowed father brings home a mysterious antique clock, sinister incidents begin to occur in his house, and throughout the neighborhood.

programme.title: Hide and Go Shriek
programme.desc: To celebrate their high school graduation, a group of rowdy teens party in a furniture store, where a psychotic killer takes them down one by one.

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: Will accepts an invitation to a dinner party hosted by his ex-wife and her new husband and begins to suspect an ambush when the affair goes awry.

programme.title: The Slumber Party Massacre
programme.desc: Trish's slumber party for her basketball teammates includes an unexpected guest.

programme.title: 50 States of Fright
programme.desc: Dave goes against Heather's last wish to get out of debt, but when someone breaks a promise, the fallout can be deadly.

programme.title: Better Watch Out
programme.desc: In this holiday horror farce, a babysitter must hold the fort and protect a 12-year-old boy during an increasingly bizarre home invasion.

programme.title: Donnie Darko (Director's Cut)
programme.desc: Sleepwalking, family drama, and strange visions of a doomsday-prophesying rabbit plague a troubled teenager in this mind-bending cult classic.

programme.title: The House on Sorority Row

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty's wildlife garden begins to take shape at Longmeadow, bees are very much at the forefront of his mind. He plants up a nectar-rich border that will attract all sorts of bees and other pollinating insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the hanging basket season well and truly underway, Joe Swift meets a florist in Surrey who has perfected the art of kokedama, a modern take on the hanging basket. Houseplants come under the spotlight too.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For the National Gardens Scheme, over 400 gardens in England and Wales will be opening to the public. Carol Klein visits one of them as they prepare for the big event. At Longmeadow a local beekeeper arrives with a swarm for Monty's new hive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift continues his quest to find the perfect hanging basket and comes up with his own design for a shady part of his garden. Monty Don has caught the bug too and demonstrates how to plant up an edible basket.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the arrival of summer by making a start on his new scented border, and offers a few suggestions for what to be getting on with this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Plants that have a head for heights come under the spotlight. At Craigieburn Garden in the Scottish Borders there is a unique collection of Himalayan plants, plus a look at a nurseryman in Hebden Bridge who has been growing alpines since he was a teenager.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don's box hedges are still riddled with blight, so it's time to call in an expert to decide on the next course of action. He also has a go at growing some mushrooms in the hope of picking a bumper crop in the autumn. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame visits the garden at Highclere Castle in Berkshire - the filming location for Downton Abbey.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein catches up with Geoff and Sally Davis to see how their garden renovation project is coming along. And Monty Don is at Longmeadow enjoying the fruits of his labour, with plenty of seasonal advice in store.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Bank Holiday weekend and there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don takes stock of what's worked and what hasn't at Longmeadow, with a view to planning ahead to the autumn. Meanwhile, James Wong goes behind the scenes at Bristol Zoo to find out more about how the animals are kept fed throughout the year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst enjoying the late season colour in the Jewel Garden as the summer begins to fade, Monty Don turns his attention to his spring borders which are in need of refurbishment if they are going to pack a punch early next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles some seasonal gardening jobs at Longmeadow and guest presenter Matthew Wilson has some ideas to brighten up a dark, north-facing wall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | BMW vs. Tesla vs. Mercedes! Bentley vs. AMG vs. McLaren!
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa presents TWO episodes of his renowned Ultimate Drag Race Replay series. First, it's BMW M3 CS vs. Tesla Model 3 Performance vs. AMG C63 E Performance. Next , it's the Bentley Continental GT Speed vs. AMG GT63 vs. McLaren GTS.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Gateway Bronco and Alfaholics Giulia Super R 270 Restomods
programme.desc: Henry drives and reviews Gateway Bronco’s latest and greatest version of its Ford Bronco restomod, the Luxe-GT.Next, Henry jumps in a much different restomod: Alfaholics' Giulia Super R 270.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Ford Country Squire Wagon & Rust-free finds in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a factory "hot rod" 1 of 1 Ford Country Squire Wagon in suburban Detroit. Next, we find Tom near Lake Havasu in Arizona where the dry weather has been kind to cars left outside for decades.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Jaguar E-Type, 1927 Chrysler, and a GTO parked for 40 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter comes across an all-original 1967 Jaguar E-Type and wide variety of MGs, along with a 1927 Chrysler 60 that's original down to the door knobs and electrical. Next up, a Pontiac GTO that has been parked for over 40 years.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - Hyundai Ioniq 5 N vs Super SUVS | Cadillic LeMans race car
programme.desc: Host Jason Cammisa races the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N against the Lamboghini Urus, Porsche Macan GTS, Jaguar F-Pace SVR and Alfa Romeo Grecale Trofeo. Next, he races Cadillac's Le Mans hypercar vs the Ferrari 296, McLaren 750S, and Porsche 911 Turbo S.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | One-off fiberglass kit cars and a Cheetah Transporter
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores the wild world of one-off fiberglass kit cars. After that he uncovers a unique Cheetah Transporter.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Hertz 1966 GT350, and a 700HP Shelby GT500
programme.desc: Shelby expert Colin Comer appraises a 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz car with a period-correct Paxton Supercharger. And if that's not enough Carroll Shelby for you, Colin checks out a 700HP 1967 Shelby GT500 with TWO Paxton superchargers!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mopars drag racing in the streets, plus a tour of Tom's barn finds
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some interesting barn finds in Northern Michigans, one of which leads to an impromptu drag race. Next, Tom gives us a tour of the barn find cars he's collected over the years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Aspen F.A.T. Ice Race and a Review of the Audi R8 GT RWD

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We sent Jay to the shark bite capital OF THE WORLD, it just so happens to be in our backyard. Watch Jay get shark bit in the scariest episode yet.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Captiva island is the land of giants. Snook, permit and tarpon are on today’s agenda.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Warb and Nick with The Hunting Public, have two days to hunt Missouri public land at the end of October. After nonstop encounters and wild rut activity, Halloween delivers the chance they’ve been waiting for.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven’s Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff & Cole of Buckventures TV, are back in Oklahoma with one big goal—catching up with the buck they call “That 170.” With a cold front rolling in, they waste no time hanging stands and getting in position for the action. Jeff breaks out the WoodHaven Intimidator grunt call and sets the stage with a decoy, hoping to pull the giant into bow range.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon gets back to his roots and explores the waterways around Cape Canaveral in his Pelican Kayak with his old Fishing buddy, Tyler Hendrix

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip back to Southwest Florida to chase after Redfish and Snook. Plus, a special tour of the Costa Custom Boat Factory

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Reed with Midwest Whitetail gets a shot at “Vinny,” a legendary 171-inch whitetail buck he's been hunting all season. Watch the story unfold as months of strategy, patience, and hard work come together in a single, heart-pounding hunt.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting camp—each with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: The team breaks down how, when, and where to create mock scrapes to attract and inventory mature bucks on your hunting property. From the science behind licking branches to choosing the perfect locations and using trail cameras to monitor activity, this episode is packed with practical tips that any hunter can use.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Good friend Mike Stone invites Willi to hunt his family ranch in Oklahoma. Good friend, Tom Petry goes along to film for his school, “Film The Hunt” and hopefully capture Willi shooting a good, Oklahoma buck.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi heads back to Ohio to hunt a lease with good friends, Nick, Tom and Jason. He had a unique hunt the previous year on a golf course. They didn’t lease the golf course this year, but it was the same group hunting a familiar piece of property.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Realtree's Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts hunt the tail end of the rut in Georgia. The bucks are still chasing the remaining does in heat as the weather cools off in the south.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell sit down to discuss the week No. 1 ups and downs, and what they learned during their first run hunting public ducks up north.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.
Get ready for one of the best seasons yet from Team200! From giant elk to monster bears and a couple 200″ whitetails, you don’t want to miss a single episode from Team200 this year!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Captiva island is the land of giants. Snook, permit and tarpon are on today’s agenda.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara pitch leeches for shallow water walleyes in tough conditions. Keeping the presentation horizontal is critical for these spooky fish!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: When crappies post up in tough cover there is no better technique than a drop shot rigged with one of Freedom Baitz's newest plastic!

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.
